src:
Deset let dvojezičnega literarnega natečaja
02 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Andraž Gombač

Na dvojezičnem literarnem natečaju Koroška v besedi - Kärnten wortwörtlich v Pliberku je nagrado za liriko v slovenskem jeziku prejela Daniela Kocmut iz Gradca, za prozo pa Franjo Frančič iz Padne v Istri.



Franjo Frančič iz Padne je v Muzeju Wernerja Berga v Pliberku nagrado prejel za zgodbo Mi in oni.  

PLIBERK > Posebnost natečaja Mestne občine Pliberk je dvojezičnost. Dobrodošla so izvirna prozna in lirska besedila na prosto temo v nemškem ali slovenskem jeziku. Letos je prispelo 78 šifriranih prispevkov iz Avstrije, Slovenije, Nemčije in Italije, ocenili pa so jih člani štirih strokovnih komisij, v kateri so slavisti, germanisti, jezikoslovci, literarni zgodovinarji in pisci.
Daniela Kocmut, leta 1980 rojena v Mariboru, je v Gradcu zaključila študij slovenščine, nemščine in angleščine. Njen učitelj in mentor je bil Fabjan Hafner (1966-2016), ki mu je posvetila eno od nagrajenih pesmi, napisano v obeh deželnih jezikih.
Franjo Frančič, leta 1958 rojen v Ljubljani, je nagrado prejel za zgodbo Mi in oni. V središču frančičevskega sredobežnega kroga je možakar, ki ob umirajočem psu opazuje propadanje tako svojega intimnega sveta kot sodobne družbe. Zgodba, ki jo je Frančič letos pod naslovom Vzemi me k sebi objavil že v istoimenski knjigi, izdani pri založbi Amalietti & Amalietti, bo prostor našla še v knjigi, s katero bodo na Koroškem decembra kronali jubilejno, deseto leto literarnega natečaja.
Nagrado v višini 500 evrov sta v kategorijah proza in lirika v nemškem jeziku prejela Harald Schwinger (1964) iz Vernberka in Tara Meister (1997) iz Šentvida ob Glini.
text:
Ten years of bilingual literary competition
02 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Andraž Gombač

At the Carinthian bilingual literary competition in the word - Kärnten wortwörtlich in Pliberk, the prize for lyric poetry in the Slovenian language was awarded to Daniela Kocmut from Graz, and to Franjo Frančič from Padna in Istria.



At the Werner Berg Museum in Pliberk, Franjo Frančič from Padna received the award for the story We and They.

PLIBERK> The specialty of the Pliberk Municipality competition is bilingualism. Original prose and lyrical texts on a free theme in German or Slovenian are welcome. This year, 78 encrypted contributions from Austria, Slovenia, Germany and Italy have been received and evaluated by members of four expert committees comprising Slavists, Germanists, linguists, literary historians and writers.
Born in Maribor in 1980, Daniela Kocmut completed her studies in Slovenian, German and English in Graz. Her teacher and mentor was Fabjan Hafner (1966-2016), to whom she dedicated one of the award-winning poems written in both provincial languages.
Franjo Frančič, born in Ljubljana in 1958, received the award for his story We and They. At the heart of the Franciscan mid-centric circle is a man who, with a dying dog, observes the decay of both his intimate world and modern society. The story, published this year by Frančič entitled Take Me To Yourself in a book of the same name, published by Amalietti & Amalietti, will find space in the book which will mark the jubilee, the tenth year of literary competition in Carinthia in December.
The $ 500 prize was awarded to Harald Schwinger (1964) of Vernberk and Tara Meister (1997) of St. John's Wort in Glina in the prose and lyric categories.
